com.tregouet.context_interpreter.data_types.construct

Interface IVariable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ISymbol
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Variable

    public interface IVariable
extends ISymbol

    A formal variable, used as a placeholder for some unspecified part of an abstract construct (IConstruct). Variables can be assigned a value by domain-specific operators (IDSOperator), which leads to the generation of a new (and less abstract) construct.

    A given variable should never be found in distinct constructs, nor in similar constructs belonging to the intent of distinct categories (ICategory). This way, a variable can be referred to as a dimension : its biding by a domain-specific operator yields a function that expresses what is common to all constructs obtained by this variable's assignment of a value, and the set of accepted values are the attributes accessible in this dimension.

    Author:
    Gael Tregouet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAssignmentCount() 
      char getVarChar() 
      void incrementAssignmentCount()
